ProductOverview.Summary: OpenHIE (Open Health Information Exchange) is a community of practice working to enable health information exchange and interoperability at national and regional levels.
ProductOverview.Description: OpenHIE provides a framework for implementing health information exchange using open standards and open source technologies. It includes reference implementations of key components like client registries, facility registries, terminology services, and document repositories. The framework is designed to be adaptable to different country contexts and health system architectures.
ProductOverview.PrimaryFunctionality: Health information exchange framework with reference implementations and standards
ProductOverview.Users: Health IT architects, system integrators, government health departments, and health information exchange implementers

Reach.SummaryOfReach: OpenHIE has been implemented in multiple countries across Africa, Asia, and Latin America to support national health information exchange initiatives.

Maturity.SummaryOfMaturity: All maturity model assessments are self-reported by the funded organization leading the development of the global good.

Community.DescriptionOfCommunity: OpenHIE has a diverse global community including implementers, developers, standards experts, and health system stakeholders from around the world.
